Charitable objects
TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN ARTS AND THE SUSTAINABLE CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND ENDANGERED SPECIES AND IN PARTICULAR THE ARTS MUSIC, DRAMA, POETRY READING, SCULPTURE, PAINTING, HANDICRAFTS AND ALL OTHER ASSOCIATED ARTS, AND TO ENCOURAGE THE PUBLIC TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SAID ARTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF CONCERTS, PERFORMANCES, EXHIBITIONS AND OTHER ITEMS NECESSARY FOR THE BETTER PERFORMANCE OF THE OBJECTS HEREINBEFORE MENTIONED DURING FESTIVAL PERIODS AND AT OTHER TIMES AS OCCASIONS ARISE.

The charitable objects of the organization are to educate the public in arts and sustainable conservation of the environment and endangered species, with a focus on arts such as music, drama, poetry reading, sculpture, painting, handicrafts, and all other associated arts. The charity seeks to encourage the public to participate in these arts by presenting concerts, performances, exhibitions, and other necessary items for better performance during festival periods and at other times as occasions arise. The ultimate goal is to promote environmental sustainability through the arts and raise awareness of endangered species and the importance of conservation efforts.

WHO ARE WE?

We are a Charitable Company Limited by Guarantee, established to promote education in arts and sustainable conservation of the environment and endangered species. Our aim is to provide a new model for working collaboratively to host educational, sustainable events and to address social and environmental issues that require our urgent attention. We strive to provide innovative and creative solutions to the challenges we face, using the power of the arts to inspire and educate the public.

As a charity, we use any financial surplus generated by our events to further our wider educational and environmental objectives. This may include seeding projects and funding educational activities that align with our mission. Our work is guided by a strong commitment to sustainability and environmental conservation, and we seek to make a positive impact on the world around us.

Governing Document

1. NAME
The name of the organization is \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ (the "Charity").
2. GOVERNING DOCUMENT
The governing document of the Charity is this document and any amendments made to it.
3. CHARITABLE OBJECTS
The Charity's objects are:
To educate the public in arts and sustainable conservation of the environment and endangered species, with a focus on arts such as music, drama, poetry reading, sculpture, painting, handicrafts, and all other associated arts. The charity seeks to encourage the public to participate in these arts by presenting concerts, performances, exhibitions, and other necessary items for better performance during festival periods and at other times as occasions arise. The ultimate goal is to promote environmental sustainability through the arts and raise awareness of endangered species and the importance of conservation efforts.
4. POWERS
In order to further the objects of the Charity, the Charity has the power to:
* Raise and receive funds from any lawful sources.
* Invest funds in a manner that is consistent with the objects of the Charity and with the provisions of the Charities Act 2011.
* Hire staff and volunteers to help carry out the objects of the Charity.
* Enter into contracts and agreements.
* Borrow money and issue debentures, mortgages, or other security, subject to the prior written consent of the Charity Commission.
* Do all other lawful things that are necessary to achieve the objects of the Charity.
5. APPLICATION OF INCOME AND PROPERTY
The income and property of the Charity shall be applied solely towards the promotion of the objects of the Charity as set out in this document.
6. BOARD OF TRUSTEES
The Charity shall be governed by a Board of Trustees (the "Trustees"), who shall be appointed in accordance with the provisions of this document.
7. APPOINTMENT OF TRUSTEES
The Trustees shall be appointed by the members of the Charity at an annual general meeting or any other meeting called for that purpose.
8. POWERS AND DUTIES OF TRUSTEES
The Trustees shall have the power and duty to:
* Manage the affairs of the Charity in accordance with this document.
* Take all necessary steps to achieve the objects of the Charity.
* Exercise all powers conferred on them by this document or by law.
* Ensure that the Charity is solvent and financially viable.
* Appoint and remove staff and volunteers.
* Delegate authority to subcommittees or staff as appropriate.
9. MEMBERSHIP
The Charity shall have members, who shall be appointed in accordance with the provisions of this document.
10. AMENDMENTS TO THIS DOCUMENT
This document may be amended by a resolution passed by a two-thirds majority of the Trustees at a meeting of the Trustees, provided that the proposed amendment has been circulated to all the Trustees at least 21 days before the meeting.
11. DISSOLUTION
The Charity may be dissolved by a resolution passed by a two-thirds majority of the members present and voting at a general meeting. If the Charity is dissolved, any remaining assets shall be transferred to one or more charitable organizations that have objects similar to those of the Charity, as determined by the members at the time of dissolution.
12. INTERPRETATION
In this document, unless the context otherwise requires:
* "Charity Commission" means the Charity Commission for England and Wales.
* "General meeting" means a meeting of the members of the Charity.
* "Member" means a member of the Charity.
* "Trustee" means a member of the Board of Trustees of the Charity.
